properties.title: Nifty Getting Started - Nifty Hello World

section.name: Hello World
section.p: In this Mini Tutorial you're going to create a very basic and simple Hello World Application to get used to Nifty.

section.name: Java Preparation
section.p: Create a new Java Project with you favorite IDE. For the sake of simplicity I assume you've downloaded the "complete" version of nifty. Just add nifty to your classpath.
Now initialize lwjgl and set the DisplayMode you want to use (This step is not covered here because it is lwjgl specific and is covered elsewhere).

subsection.name: Create the Nifty Instance and load a XML-File
subsection.p: Everything you do within Nifty is done with an Instance of the Nifty class. To create one you'll need to give it the RenderDevice you want to use. At the moment only a RenderDeviceLwjgl implementation is available. With Nifty you can easily add sound to your gui, so you need to give it the SoundSystem that it should use too.
subsection.source: Nifty nifty = new Nifty( new RenderDeviceLwjgl(), new SoundSystem(new SlickSoundLoader()), new TimeProvider(), false);
subsection.p: To load a xml gui file and initializes the rendering you simply use the fromXml() method. Creating the actual XML-File is covered below.

subsection.name: Lwjgl Renderloop with Nifty
subsection.p: This is your basic lwjgl render loop. You'll need to call Niftys render() method once a frame. And you'll need to forward Keyboard-Events to Nifty so that it can respond to them.
